default.description:
Login authentication method(s) as a string.
Examples:
- "group tacacs+ local"
- "group MYGROUP none"
- "group radius group MYGROUP local"
default.title: Default

console.description:
Console authentication method(s) as a string.
Examples:
- "group tacacs+ local"
- "group MYGROUP none"
- "group radius group MYGROUP local"

Enable authentication method(s) as a string.
Examples:
- "group tacacs+ local"
- "group MYGROUP none"
- "group radius group MYGROUP local"

default.description:
802.1x authentication method(s) as a string.
Examples:
- "group radius"
- "group MYGROUP group radius"

default.description:
Exec authorization method(s) as a string.

- "group MYGROUP none"

Command authorization method(s) as a string.

- "group tacacs+ local"

default.description:
Command authorization method(s) as a string.

- "group tacacs+ local"
- "group MYGROUP none"
- "group tacacs+ group MYGROUP local"

action.description:
Action as string
Example: "deny ip any any"
action.title: Action

disabled.description: Disable IP locking on configured ports
disabled.title: Disabled

expiration_mac_disabled.description: Configure deauthorizing locked addresses upon MAC aging out
expiration_mac_disabled.title: Expiration MAC Disabled

ipv4_enforcement_disabled.description: Configure enforcement for locked IPv4 addresses
ipv4_enforcement_disabled.title: IPv4 Enforcement Disabled

ipv6_enforcement_disabled.description: Configure enforcement for locked IPv6 addresses
ipv6_enforcement_disabled.title: IPv6 Enforcement Disabled

aliases.description:
Multi-line string with one or more alias commands.

Example:

```yaml
aliases: |
  alias wr copy running-config startup-config
  alias siib show ip interface brief
```
aliases.title: Aliases

avd_data_conversion_mode.description:
Conversion Mode for AVD input data conversion.
Input data conversion will perform type conversion of input variables as defined in the schema.
The type conversion is intended to help the user to identify minor issues with the input data, while still allowing the data to be validated.
During conversion, messages will generated with information about the host(s) and key(s) which required conversion.
"disabled" means that conversion will not run - avoid this since conversion is also handling data deprecation and upgrade.
"error" will produce error messages and fail the task.
"warning" will produce warning messages.
"info" will produce regular log messages.
"debug" will produce hidden debug messages viewable with -v.
"quiet" will not produce any messages
avd_data_conversion_mode.title: AVD Data Conversion Mode

avd_data_validation_mode.description:
Validation Mode for AVD input data validation.
Input data validation will validate the input variables according to the schema.
During validation, messages will generated with information about the host(s) and key(s) which failed validation.
"disabled" means that validation will not run.
"error" will produce error messages and fail the task.
"warning" will produce warning messages.
"info" will produce regular log messages.
"debug" will produce hidden debug messages viewable with -v.
avd_data_validation_mode.title: AVD Data Validation Mode

login.description: Multiline string ending with EOF on the last line
login.title: Login

motd.description: Multiline string ending with EOF on the last line
motd.title: Motd

vlan.description: VLAN value(s) or range(s) of VLAN values
vlan.title: VLAN

custom_templates.title: Extensibility with Custom Templates
custom_templates.description:
- Custom templates can be added below the playbook directory.
- If a location above the directory is desired, a symbolic link can be used.
- Example under the `playbooks` directory create symbolic link with the following command:

  ```bash
  ln -s ../../shared_repo/custom_avd_templates/ ./custom_avd_templates
  ```

- The output will be rendered at the end of the configuration.
- The order of custom templates in the list can be important if they overlap.
- It is recommended to use a `!` delimiter at the top of each custom template.

Add `custom_templates` to group/host variables:

items.description: Template relative path below playbook directory

cvx.description: CVX server features are not supported on physical switches. See `management_cvx` for client configurations.
cvx.title: CVX

daemon_terminattr.description:
You can either provide a list of IPs/FQDNs to target on-premise Cloudvision cluster or use DNS name for your Cloudvision as a Service instance.
Streaming to multiple clusters both on-prem and cloud service is supported.

!!! note
    For TerminAttr version recommendation and EOS compatibility matrix, please refer to the latest TerminAttr Release Notes
    which always contain the latest recommended versions and minimum required versions per EOS release.

cvaddrs.description:
Streaming address(es) for CloudVision single cluster
- TCP 9910 is used for CV on-prem
- TCP 443 is used for CV as a Service
cvaddrs.title: Cvaddrs

cvaddrs.description:
Streaming address(es) for CloudVision cluster
- TCP 9910 is used for CV on-prem
- TCP 443 is used for CV as a Service
cvaddrs.title: Cvaddrs

e.g. "/persist/secure/ssl/terminattr/primary/certs/ca.crt"

key_file.description:
Client certificate key file path
e.g. "/persist/secure/ssl/terminattr/primary/keys/client.key"
key_file.title: Key File

cvauth.title: Cvauth

cvobscurekeyfile.description: Encrypt the private key used for authentication to CloudVision
cvobscurekeyfile.title: Cvobscurekeyfile

cvproxy.description:
Proxy server through which CloudVision is reachable. Useful when the CloudVision server is hosted in the cloud.
The expected form is http://[user:password@]ip:port, e.g.: `http://arista:arista@10.83.12.78:3128`. Available as of TerminAttr v1.13.0

Disable AAA authorization and accounting.
When setting this flag, all commands pushed from CloudVision are applied directly to the CLI without authorization

Set the gRPC server address, the default is 127.0.0.1:6042
e.g. "MGMT/0.0.0.0:6042"

Exclude paths from Sysdb on the ingest side.
e.g. "/Sysdb/cell/1/agent,/Sysdb/cell/2/agent"

smashexcludes.description:
Exclude paths from the shared memory table.
e.g. "ale,flexCounter,hardware,kni,pulse,strata"

taillogs.description:
Enable log file collection; /var/log/messages is streamed by default if no path is set.
e.g. "/var/log/messages"

Enable IPFIX provider (TerminAttr default is true).
This flag is enabled by default and does not have to be added to the daemon configuration.

The default compression scheme when streaming to CloudVision is gzip since TerminAttr 1.6.1 and CVP 2019.1.0.
There is no need to change the compression scheme.
This key is deprecated. Support will be removed in AVD version v5.0.0.

generate_default_config.description:
The `generate_default_config` knob allows to omit default EOS configuration.
This can be useful when leveraging `eos_cli_config_gen` to generate configlets with CloudVision.

The following commands will be omitted when `generate_default_config` is set to `false`:

- RANCID Content Type
- Hostname
- Default configuration for `aaa`
- Default configuration for `enable password`
- Transceiver qsfp default mode
- End of configuration delimiter
generate_default_config.title: Generate Default Config

features.description:
This data model allows to configure the list of hardware counters feature
available on Arista platforms.

The `name` key accepts a list of valid_values which MUST be updated to support
new feature as they are released in EOS.

The available values of the different keys like 'direction' or 'address_type'
are feature and hardware dependent and this model DOES NOT validate that the
combinations are valid. It is the responsability of the user of this data model
to make sure that the rendered CLI is accepted by the targeted device.

Examples:

  * Use:
    ```yaml
    hardware_counters:
      features:
        - name: ip
          direction: out
          layer3: true
          units_packets: true
    ```

    to render:
    ```eos
    hardware counter feature ip out layer3 units packets
    ```
  * Use:
    ```yaml
    hardware_counters:
      features:
        - name: route
          address_type: ipv4
          vrf: test
          prefix: 192.168.0.0/24
    ```

    to render:
    ```eos
    hardware counter feature route ipv4 vrf test 192.168.0.0/24
    ```

direction.description:
Most features support only 'in' and 'out'. Some like traffic-policy support 'cpu'.
Some features DO NOT have any direction.
This validation IS NOT made by the schemas.
direction.title: Direction

address_type.description:
Supported only for the following features:
- acl: [ipv4, ipv6, mac] if direction is 'out'
- multicast: [ipv4, ipv6]
- route: [ipv4, ipv6]
This validation IS NOT made by the schemas.
address_type.title: Address Type

vrf.description:
Supported only for the 'route' feature.
This validation IS NOT made by the schemas.
vrf.title: VRF

prefix.description:
Supported only for the 'route' feature.
Mandatory for the 'route' feature.
This validation IS NOT made by the schemas.
prefix.title: Prefix

features.title: Features

items.description:
EOS CLI interface command
Example: "switchport mode access"

remark.description:
Comment up to 100 characters.
If remark is defined, other keys in acl entry will be ignored.
remark.title: Remark

action.description:
ACL action.
Required for standard entry.
action.title: Action

protocol.description:
ip, tcp, udp, icmp or other protocol name or number.
Required for standard entry.

source.description:
any, A.B.C.D/E or A.B.C.D.
A.B.C.D without a mask means host.
Required for standard entry.
source.title: Source

items.description: TCP/UDP source port name or number.

destination.description:
any, A.B.C.D/E or A.B.C.D.
A.B.C.D without a mask means host.
Required for standard entry.
destination.title: Destination

items.description: TCP/UDP destination port name or number.

notification_timestamp.description:
Per the gNMI specification, the default timestamp field of a notification message is set to be
the time at which the value of the underlying data source changes or when the reported event takes place.
In order to facilitate integration in legacy environments oriented around polling style operations,
an option to support overriding the timestamp field to the send-time is available from EOS 4.27.0F.
notification_timestamp.title: Notification Timestamp

port.description:
GNMI port.
Make sure to update the control-plane ACL accordingly in order for the service to be reachable by external applications.
port.title: Port

shutdown.description: Operational status of the gRPC tunnel
shutdown.title: Shutdown

use_serial_number.description: Use serial number as the Target ID
use_serial_number.title: Use Serial Number

enable_vrfs.description:
These should not be mixed with the new keys above.

This key is deprecated. Support will be removed in AVD version 5.0.0. Use <samp>transport.grpc</samp> instead.
enable_vrfs.title: Enable VRFs

octa.description:
These should not be mixed with the new keys above.
Octa activates `eos-native` provider and it is the only provider currently supported by EOS.
This key is deprecated. Support will be removed in AVD version 5.0.0. Use <samp>provider</samp> instead.
octa.title: Octa

default_services.description: Enable default services: capi-doc and tapagg
default_services.title: Default Services

certificate.description: Name of certificate; private key must also be specified
certificate.title: Certificate

private_key.description: Name of private key; certificate must also be specified
private_key.title: Private Key

speed.description: Speed should be set in the format `<interface_speed>` or `forced <interface_speed>` or `auto <interface_speed>`.
speed.title: Speed

gateway.description: IPv4 address of default gateway in management VRF
gateway.title: Gateway

ipv6_gateway.title: IPv6 Gateway

eos_cli.description: Multiline EOS CLI rendered directly on the management interface in the final EOS configuration

List of allowed TLS versions as string

  - "1.0"
  - "1.0 1.1"

cipher_list syntax follows the openssl cipher strings format.
Colon (:) separated list of allowed ciphers as a string

certificates.description:
List of trust certificate names
Examples:
  - test1.crt
  - test2.crt

hostname_fqdn.description: Enforce hostname to be FQDN without wildcard.
hostname_fqdn.title: Hostname Fqdn

certificates.description:
List of chain certificate names

  - chain1.crt
  - chain2.crt

key_exchange.description: Cryptographic key exchange methods for SSH to use
key_exchange.title: Key Exchange

mac.description: Cryptographic MAC algorithms for SSH to use
mac.title: MAC

limit.description: Maximum total number of SSH sessions to device
limit.title: Limit

per_host.description: Maximum number of SSH sessions to device from a single host
per_host.title: Per Host

count_max.description: Number of keep-alive packets that can be sent without a response before the connection is assumed dead.
count_max.title: Count Max

interval.title: Interval

type.description: The supported values for type are platform dependent.
type.title: Type

Interface range(s) should be of same type, Ethernet, Loopback, Management etc.
Multiple interface ranges can be specified separated by ","

trusted_keys.description: List of trusted-keys as string ex. 10-12,15
trusted_keys.title: Trusted Keys

String with relevant endpoint depending on type.

- "Ethernet1"
- "Ethernet1 dot1q vlan 123"
- "bgp vpws TENANT_A pseudowire VPWS_PW_1"
- "ldp LDP_PW_1"

connectors.title: Connectors

match.description:
Match as string

platform.description: Every key below this point is platform dependent.

Set Nexthop

List of switchport vlans as string
For a trunk port this would be a range like "1-200,300"
For an access port this would be a single vlan "123"

required if 'nat_type' is pool, pool-address-only or pool-full-cone

timeout.description:
Timeout in seconds after which port should be errdisabled or
should start dropping on congested priorities.
This should be decimal with up to 2 decimal point.
Example: 0.01 or 60
timeout.title: Timeout

polling_interval.description:
Time interval in seconds at which the watchdog should poll the queues.
This should be decimal with up to 3 decimal point.
Example: 0.005 or 60
polling_interval.title: Polling Interval

recovery_time.description:
Recovery-time in seconds after which stuck queue should
recover and start forwarding again.
This should be decimal with up to 2 decimal point.
Example: 0.01 or 60
recovery_time.title: Recovery Time

override_action_drop.description: Override configured action on stuck queue to drop.
override_action_drop.title: Override Action Drop

enabled.description:
Allow non-ect and set drop-precedence 1 in a policy map simultaneously.
Check which command is required for your platform.
enabled.title: Enabled

Supported options are platform dependent
Example: "< rate > kbps", "1-100 percent", "< rate > pps"
rate.title: Rate

Supported options are platform dependent

watchdog.description: Watchdog can detect stuck transmit queues.

enabled.description: Enable the watchdog on stuck transmit queues.
enabled.title: Enabled

action.description:
Override the default error-disable action to either drop
traffic on the stuck queue or notify-only
without making any actions on the stuck queue.
action.title: Action

timeout.description:
Timeout in seconds after which port should be errdisabled or
should start dropping on congested priorities.
This should be decimal with up to 2 decimal point
Example: 0.01 or 60
timeout.title: Timeout

polling_interval.description:
Time interval in seconds at which the watchdog should poll the queues.
This should be decimal with up to 3 decimal point or set
to 'auto' based on recovery_time and timeout values.
Example: 0.005 or 60
polling_interval.title: Polling Interval

recovery_time.description:
Recovery-time in seconds after which stuck queue should
recover and start forwarding again.
This should be decimal with up to 2 decimal point.
Example: 0.01 or 60
recovery_time.title: Recovery Time

forced.description:
Force recover any stuck queue(s) after the duration,
irrespective of whether PFC frames are being
received or not.
forced.title: Forced

watchdog.title: Watchdog

priorities.description: Set the drop/no_drop on each queue

no_drop.description: Enable Priority Flow Control frames on this queue
no_drop.title: No Drop

priorities.title: Priorities

high.description: Default high threshold for Ethernet Interfaces.
high.title: High

low.description:
Default low threshold for Ethernet Interfaces.
Low threshold support is platform dependent.
low.title: Low

notifying.description: Should only be used for platforms supporting the "queue-monitor length notifying" CLI
notifying.title: Notifying

as.description: BGP AS <1-4294967295> or AS number in asdot notation "<1-65535>.<0-65535>"

restart_time.description:
Number of seconds
graceful-restart-help long-lived and restart-time are mutually exclusive in CLI.
restart-time will take precedence if both are configured.
restart_time.title: Restart Time

long_lived.description:
graceful-restart-help long-lived and restart-time are mutually exclusive in CLI.
restart-time will take precedence if both are configured.

wait_for_convergence.description: Disables FIB updates and route advertisement when the BGP instance is initiated until the BGP convergence state is reached.
wait_for_convergence.title: Wait For Convergence

wait_install.description:
Do not advertise reachability to a prefix until that prefix has been installed in hardware.
This will eliminate any temporary black holes due to a BGP speaker advertising reachability to a prefix that may not yet be installed into the forwarding plane.
wait_install.title: Wait Install

source_prefix.description: Source address A.B.C.D or Source prefix A.B.C.D/E
source_prefix.title: Source Prefix

nexthop.description: Next-hop IP address or interface name
nexthop.title: Nexthop

rx_min_interval.description: Min interval in msecs between accepting the same LSA
rx_min_interval.title: RX Min Interval

initial.description: Delay to generate first occurrence of LSA in msecs
initial.title: Initial

min.description: Min delay between originating the same LSA in msecs
min.title: Min

max.description: 1-600000 Maximum delay between originating the same LSA in msec
max.title: Max

initial.description: Initial SPF schedule delay in msecs
initial.title: Initial

min.description: Min Hold time between two SPFs in msecs
min.title: Min

max.description: Max wait time between two SPFs in msecs
max.title: Max

metric_type.description: OSPF metric type for default route
metric_type.title: Metric Type

metric_type.description: OSPF metric type for default route

eos_cli.title: EOS CLI

ipsec_profile.description: IPSec profile for the path group.
ipsec_profile.title: Ipsec Profile

flow_assignment.description: Flow assignement `lan` can not be configured in a path group with dynamic peers.
flow_assignment.title: Flow Assignment

dynamic_peers.description: Flow assignement `lan` can not be configured in a path group with dynamic peers.
dynamic_peers.title: Dynamic Peers

jitter.description: Jitter requirement for this load balance policy in milliseconds.
jitter.title: Jitter

latency.description: One way delay requirement for this load balance policy in milliseconds.
latency.title: Latency

loss_rate.description:
Loss Rate requirement in percentage for this load balance policy.
Value between 0.00 and 100.00 %
loss_rate.title: Loss Rate

path_groups.description: List of path-groups to use for this load balance policy.

priority.description:
Priority for this path-group.
The EOS default value is 1.
priority.title: Priority

path_groups.title: Path Groups

path_selection_policy.description: DPS policy name to use for this VRF.
path_selection_policy.title: Path Selection Policy

router_service_insertion.description: Configure network services inserted to data forwarding
router_service_insertion.title: Router Service Insertion

source.description:
Source IP Address.
"source" and "source_interface" are mutually exclusive. If both are defined, "source_interface" takes precedence.
source.title: Source

source.description:
Source IP Address.
"source" and "source_interface" are mutually exclusive. If both are defined, "source_interface" takes precedence.
source.title: Source

unmodified.description:
Enable egress sFlow unmodified.
Platform dependent feature.
unmodified.title: Unmodified

address.description: Hostname or IP of remote engine
address.title: Address

remote_address.description:
Hostname or ip of remote engine
The remote_address and udp_port are used for remote users
remote_address.title: Remote Address

udp_port.description: udp_port will not be used if no remote_address is configured
udp_port.title: UDP Port

localized.description: Engine ID in hexadecimal for localizing auth and/or priv
localized.title: Localized

auth_passphrase.description: Hashed authentication passphrase if localized is used else cleartext authentication passphrase
auth_passphrase.title: Auth Passphrase

priv_passphrase.description: Hashed privacy passphrase if localized is used else cleartext privacy passphrase
priv_passphrase.title: Priv Passphrase

name.description:
Enable or disable specific snmp-traps and their sub_traps
Examples:
- "bgp"
- "bgp established"
name.title: Name

count.description: Maximum number of BPDUs per timer interval
count.title: Count

action.description:
Action as string
Example: "deny ip any any"
action.title: Action

server_profiles.description: List of server profiles for the client
server_profiles.title: Server Profiles

truncation_size.description: Allowed truncation_size values vary depending on the platform
truncation_size.title: Truncation Size

timestamp.description: mac.timestamp.replace_source_mac and mac.timestamp.header.format are mutually exclsuive. If both are defined, replace_source_mac takes precedence
timestamp.title: Timestamp

fcs_append.description: mac.fcs_append and mac.fcs_error are mutually exclusive. If both are defined, mac.fcs_append takes precedence
fcs_append.title: FCS Append

config.description:
TCAM Profile Config. Since these can be very long, it is often a good idea to import the config from a file.
Example: "{{ lookup('file', 'TCAM_TRAFFIC_POLICY.conf') }}"
config.title: Config

source.description: TCAM profile local source path. Used to read the TCAM profile from a local path existing on the device.
source.title: Source

fragment.description:
The 'fragment' command is not supported when 'source port'
or 'destination port' command is configured
fragment.title: Fragment

direction.description:
Egress or ingress can be the default. This depends on source/destination, EOS version, and hardware platform.
EOS might remove this keyword in the configuration. So, check the configuration on targeted HW/SW.

required if 'nat_type' is pool, pool-address-only or pool-full-cone
ignored if 'nat_type' is overload

direction.description:
Egress or ingress can be the default. This depends on source/destination, EOS version, and hardware platform.
EOS might remove this keyword in the configuration. So, check the configuration on targeted HW/SW.
direction.title: Direction

ipv6_address_virtual.description:
IPv6_address/Mask
If both "ipv6_address_virtual" and "ipv6_address_virtuals" are set, all addresses will be configured

This key is deprecated. Support will be removed in AVD version 5.0.0. Use <samp>ipv6_address_virtuals</samp> instead.
ipv6_address_virtual.title: IPv6 Address Virtual

ipv6_address_virtuals.description: The new "ipv6_address_virtuals" key support multiple virtual ipv6 addresses.
ipv6_address_virtuals.title: IPv6 Address Virtuals

ipv6_virtual_router_address.description:
"ipv6_virtual_router_address" should not be mixed with
the new "ipv6_virtual_router_addresses" key below to avoid conflicts.

ipv6_virtual_router_addresses.title: IPv6 Virtual Router Addresses

qos.description:
For the Traffic Class to be derived based on the outer DSCP field of the incoming VxLan packet, the core ports must be in "DSCP Trust" mode.
!!!Warning, only few hardware types with software version >= 4.26.0 support the below knobs to configure Vxlan DSCP mapping.

ecn_propagation.description: Enable copying the ECN marking to/from encapsulated packets.
ecn_propagation.title: Ecn Propagation

map_dscp_to_traffic_class_decapsulation.title: Map DSCP To Traffic Class Decapsulation

qos.title: QOS
